citation.article-title: Aminobacterium mobile sp. nov., a new anaerobic amino-acid-degrading bacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aminobacterium mobile sp. nov.
Aminobacterium mobile (mo'bi.le. L. masc. adj. mobile motile)
Slightly curved to rod-shaped bacterium 0.2-0.3x4.0-5.0 μm in size, occurring singly or (rarely) in chains.
Colonies (up to 1.0 mm) are round, smooth, lens-shaped and white.
The optimal growth temperature is 37 °C and growth occurs in the temperature range 20-42 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.6-8.5, with an optimum at pH 7.3.
Strain ILE-3T does not require NaCl for growth but tolerates up to 1.5% NaCl, with optimum growth occurring at 0.05-0.5% NaCl.
Ferments serine, threonine, glycine and pyruvate and uses alanine, glutamate, valine, leucine, isoleucine and aspartate only in co-culture with Methanobacterium formicicum.

No growth observed on succinate, malate, fumarate, citrate, lactate, glucose, sucrose, ribose, xylose, cellobiose, melibiose, maltose, galactose, mannose, arabinose, rhamnose, lactose, sorbose, mannitol, acetate, propionate, butyrate, glycerol, ethanol, gelatin or casein.
The G+C content of the DNA is 44 mol%.
Isolated from anaerobic sludge of a dairy wastewater treatment plant in Santa Fe de Bogota, Colombia.
